description.narrative: The Mwanamake, Amanu na Usalama 2.0 programme works on women, peace, and security in Democratic Republic of Congo (North and South Kivu) and Burundi. The programme's objective is that women and girls in DRC and Burundi participate meaningfully in conflict prevention, resolution, mediation, peacebuilding and protection. The MAnU 2.0 Consortium consists of Mensen met een Missie, CARE Nederland, and SPR (Synergie des Femmes pour la Paix et la Réconciliation des Peuples des Grands Lacs d’Afrique). MAnU 2.0 is funded by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs for five years - 2021-2025.
Women and girl leaders advocate for the promotion of women’s participation and equal rights at the local, provincial, national and regional levels

Women and girls are protected through effective application of laws and policies that contribute to gender equality

comment.narrative: MANU 2.0 will contribute towards the improvement of adoption of Dutch NAP 1325 through three goals:  Increase women’s participation in political and other decision-making and women in leadership  Prevent and eliminate violence against women and girls  Strengthen the role of women in conflict prevention and peace processes, and protect them in conflict situations
